description: From Middle English hiȝly, heȝly, heyȝliche, from Old English hēalīce (“highly”), equivalent to high +‎ -ly. Cognate with Dutch hoogelijk (“highly”), German höchlich (“highly”), Danish højlig (“highly”), Swedish högligen (“highly”).

adverbs.description: highly (comparative highlier or more highly, superlative highliest or most highly)

entries.meaning: In a high or esteemed manner.

examples: He is in a highly visible job.
